phrases: yume kanaeru made chousen wa tsuzuku
juunengo no mirai kagayaiteru sugata wa
koukai wa shinai jibun de egaita story
makenai to i am about to mune ni chikatta
yume no tochuu de meguriau deai to wakare
kimi ga oshietekureta boku dake ga motsu chikara
Baby I trust you my friend
Honestly, I thought they would have a tough time in Jack,
but their ranking has settled down nicely on the surveys.
It looks like we all work well together.
All right, I am coming now.
It is been one thing after another for him.
The volume and the front page color spread...
Mashiro's been having to deal with more and more responsibilities,
but when we were together, we got too excited, and I did not realize his condition.
For a high school student, it is probably the worst thing.
There is no point in agonizing over it.
Since he regained consciousness and was brought to the hospital,
he should be okay for now.
What is important right now is checking up on his condition.
We do not know yet; they are still examining him.
It is impossible to do this while still in school, after all...
Thank you for taking care of my son.
How can we possibly apologize for letting things get to this point?
It is all right... we still do not know what his condition's like.
And this is something my son chose for himself.
Doctor... is Saiko is Mashiro okay?!
I am sorry, he and Mashiro are a pair of manga artists,
and we are from the publisher.
Please let us know his condition as well, if you can.
So basically, you need to remove a portion of his liver?
I have got to draw here in the hospital.
The front page color spread is the greatest chance we have been given.
Doctor, he is supposed to rest, right?
He will also need to be hospitalized for three months after the surgery...
I am going back to work.
People do not die so easily.
You will not die now, but your condition will worsen if you keep pushing yourself!
This is not an illness you can recover from naturally.
You need to stay hospitalized and undergo treatment...
We are being serialized in a weekly magazine.
For now, you need to rest...
You cannot rest on a weekly publication!
I do not want to go on hiatus!
Not when we have finally gotten popular...
But should not curing your illness come first?
You of all people should understand.
This is different from a long-running manga taking a break!
Mashiro... is it true that you had only two more pages of chapter 19 to pen-in?
For now, we will leave 19 to the assistants to finish up.
We will reconsider what happens after that.
I want to pen-in the characters myself.
How long will it take you?
But I want to take a day to do the color spread that goes with it.
My son is not a manga-drawing robot!
I was just trying to persuade him, but I got caught up in it...
While he is in the hospital, I will take responsibility and make sure he rests.
I have to consult the higher-ups before deciding what to do next.
Mashiro will have to be hospitalized for a while, it seems.
They will tell us more tomorrow.
Even so, there is no point in us getting depressed.
What we should be doing now is finishing up the 16 pages of chapter 19 that are penned-in.
Let us make this the best manuscript so far.
Is it okay for you to be making calls?
I asked them to let me go to the bathroom by myself, at least.
More importantly, bring the manuscript to the hospital.
I will draw in the hospital.
I definitely will not let it fall behind.
My hospital room is empty aside from one old guy.
I think I can do it without the doctor noticing.
It is much easier than Nakai doing it in the park!
I will wait until you have fully recovered.
We cannot afford to drop the ball on this now!
If we stall for three months, we will lose the readers we finally pulled in!
That is the only day I will not be able to draw!
It is our chance to surpass Eiji!
Mashiro said he wants to do the penning-in of the characters himself.
But that will be tough, realistically speaking.
And not only that; we have to rethink serializing a high school student.
As for the other two pages,
we will publish one of them with the announcement of the hiatus that begins next week.
And listening to your story, it seems that Mashiro cannot even touch a pen in the hospital.
Keep visiting the hospital and monitor the situation as much as you can.
It should be obvious, but the health of the author comes first.
Follow the doctor's orders, not the will of the author.
It is definitely a safe surgery, right?
They said it is a simple surgery, so there should not be any problems.
The surgery is two weeks from the 10th.
He will be hospitalized for at least three months.
We will probably be on hiatus during that time...
Well, that is how it is.
Saiko asked me to bring the manuscript to the hospital.
Of course you cannot do that.
When I considered his feelings, I could not answer any other way.
If he is really your friend, you need to stop him!
But I do not want to go on hiatus either!
Our rankings went up, we got a color spread...
If I were in Saiko's place, I would draw even if it meant dying!
Even so... you cannot draw manga if you are dead!
And even if you do not die, it is a bad idea to draw manga while in bad health...
I want to have a long-running popular manga in first place!
No matter how many years it takes.
It is only natural that an assistant should take care of the author.
Well, there is no need to do that, and my mom should be here soon...
I already met your mom yesterday.
Ah, that is not what I mean...
Shujin, where the hell are you?
You were supposed to bring the manuscript at 3!
Um, I will be going then.
Ah, yeah, I will leave the work to you!
You do not need to emphasize work so much...
Oh, she looks like a doll!
I think it is okay for me to come in...
We are only supposed to meet after our dreams come true...
But you were going to meet me at my house a while ago.
Right now, I am moving quickly towards realizing my dream...
As long as I continue the serialization nonstop for a bit longer, I will definitely...
Then, even though it is a bit embarrassing, I will speak from here.
We can at least talk, right?
You are going to wait until after you recover to draw, right?
I will not let the manuscript fall behind.
Shujin, hurry up and bring it here!
If you do not say you will not draw until you are released from the hospital...
If you will hate me for something like that, then go ahead and hate me.
I will not leave until you say you will not draw!
You say that, knowing that I cannot hate you.
Even though you cannot, you are worse for saying you can.
Since I have liked you for eight years, there is no way I could hate you.
It is the first time she is said she likes me!
You do not want to get more cavities, do you?
Mom, I really like this painting.
It is funny how it is spelled Saiko but read like Moritaka.
Saiko, your art got put up again?
Do not you want to be a manga artist when you grow up?
Is not your art too different?
The basics are what is important, stupid.
Come on, let us go to the cardboard boat tournament.
Ever since I saw that painting...
Ever since then, I was really interested in you.
Since I lived close to the school, I would look for you on the way to and from it...
It is the compass my uncle uses!
You put ink on it and draw!
It is for pro manga authors!
We are just buying a compass for math, right?
Yama, how much do you have on you?
Saiko, are you listening to me?
Kaya, how much do you have?
I really liked how your eyes sparkled when you looked at the compass.
At the swim meet, I was watching you constantly, trying to convey my feelings.
That is when I first noticed her.
We went to the same middle school and both got placed in Class 3...
So after our dreams come true, please marry me!
I was so happy I could die.
But if we die, our dreams will not come true.
I have always liked you, and you are irreplaceable to me now...
I want you to stop drawing until you are released, for my sake.
D-Do you... value manga more than me?
but if you put it that way,
Somehow, I feel just like Joe from Ashita no Joe when he went to his final match.
So Azuki could not stop him?
I am really pumped up right now!
Hurry up and bring the manuscript!
I will be there in 20... no, 15 minutes!
I am sorry for telling Azuki!
Yeah, right now the editorial department is topsy turvy.
I thought of a good story that will not lose to TRAP's front page color spread.
I wanted to compete with them.
Well he is sick, so nothing can be done about it.
I think it was Yakusa Municipal Hospital...
Since we have seen each other, you can come inside...
And such a cute girl, too.
I guess manga was not his girlfriend, after all.
I almost ran into your mom at the entrance!
I brought some crow quill pens and spoon pens, too.
I have color pens, so I will start with chapter 20's color page.
I will finish chapter 19 by tomorrow, so if you take it to the office right away, we should make it in time.
Azuki... she is gotten more mature, or prettier, you could say.
Why did you bring the manuscript?
You are the one who asked me to stop him.
Because I am a guy, I guess?
Even you feel something when looking at him working so hard, right?
Speaking of which, this is the first time I have seen him while he is drawing manga.
You are working on your color page, are not you?
Niizuma, you cannot run inside a hospital.
It is not good to interrupt someone is work.
But I am glad I came!
I told you not to run!
That cute girl is Mashiro's girlfriend?
I would have thought she was Takagi's...
She looks just like TRAP's heroine, Ami.
Yeah, I would not think you were a Jack editor.
Well, she is cuter than Ami.
Miura, what the heck are you doing?!
I am arranging a substitute manuscript for TRAP...
Mashiro is drawing the manuscript in the hospital!
It will be difficult with just the two of us here...
I am just too embarrassed and cannot look at your face.
Takagi, can you stay until I leave?
No, we should show it to him.
Let him know we are still going to make the deadline.
Chapter 20's color page is going well.
I will finish penning-in chapter 19 tomorrow, and it can be finalized soon after.
I can draw in the hospital just fine.
I definitely will not let the manuscript fall behind.
No, stopping him is my job.
Takagi, hurry up and call the nurse!
Mashiro is saying he is fine.
Takagi, when you brought the manuscript here, you were prepared to have him draw no matter what, right?
If you make him stop here, you should not have brought it at all.
Mashiro, let us do our best.
I know you can draw without resting.
Let us make our dreams come true.
I-I cannot tell him to stop drawing.
Serializing while in high school was too tough, huh.
My health is also kind of
I value my health more than my dreams.

The fight does not end until I fulfill my dream
I wonder how far I have come now?
In ten years, I will be living the dream
It is the scenario I wrote for myself, so I will have no regrets
But life is not that easy, and it is full of obstacles
Still, I swear to myself that I will not ever back down
I have a dream that I absolutely want to achieve
So I fuel my passion until I succeed
There will be meetings and partings along the way
But I will simply believe in my strength that you have taught me
And rise back up again and again and again
zetsubou ni fushita kokoro no sumi
tooriame no ato ni mitsuketa niji wo motte
In this world, every day is dull and full of nonsense
I cover my ears, trying to mute the noise
Why do people hurt each other?
on the recesses of my heart, fallen into despair
While carrying this pain in my chest,
can I really dream of tomorrow?
can I really dream of tomorrow?
Remembering the rainbow I found after the rain,
I thought it would look cool to draw a lot of birds and greenery.
The background is the pond at Yakusa Shrine!
Please, for my sake, stop drawing.
